Title: A PARTNERSHIP APPROACH TO DESIGNING AND BUILDING NEW WEBSITES FOR TWO NEW UNITARY AUTHORITIES- Future Northants
Description:
A Partnership Approach to Designing and Building New Websites for Two New Unitary Authorities this contract is awarded through Daventry District Council.

The creation of the West and North Northamptonshire Unitary Authorities on 1st April 2021 is an important opportunity to transform services for residents and the new Authorities. A key part of this transformation will be designing our online digital experiences fit for the 'digital' age ahead. 
The new Authorities websites will be the front face of the changes. They present both a challenge and an opportunity to redesign our services solving customer problems efficiently and effectively via enabling self-service where possible. 
Our approach will emphasise designing for user needs, agile development and collaborative working to benefit from the skills and experience of our colleagues across the public sector.

Title: COV - One Coventry User Led Service Design Consultancy - AWARD
Description:
User Led Service Design is one of the fundamental principles of Government Digital Services (GDS) and the Local Digital Declaration (of which Coventry City Council is a signatory).  As part of the Digital First Programme the Design workstream focuses on adopting a user led service design approach to reviewing our services and identifying and delivering opportunities for improved customer outcomes and efficiencies.  
      
      Coventry Council is seeking to award a contract to a supplier who will work in a partnership approach to develop and deliver a user centred design solution  for the Council. Further details can be found in the tender documentation.

Title: Land Use Planning Viability Assessment Tool
Description:
The Catapult is seeking to award a contract to a Supplier to deliver an Alpha project into the land use planning viability assessment process. The Catapult is working with a partnership of public agencies (Greater London Authority, London Borough of Southwark and London Borough of Tower Hamlets) who are seeking to make the viability assessment process in planning more transparent, effective and efficient. 

The viability assessment process involves property developers providing local authorities with a self-generated assessment of the costs involved in bringing about development (eg. Buying land, providing affordable housing, construction costs, profit etc) and the income from development (selling homes, renting homes etc). In this process there is a significant information asymmetry between developer and local planning authority, a lack of accessibility to members of the public and is a barrier to small developers becoming larger developers. Previous Discovery work has indicated that better use of data and digital tools could assist in addressing some of these challenges, and we wish to progress to an Alpha phase were concepts developed in the Discovery work are developed into working prototypes.

Further and complete information can be found in the information document on the Procurement Portal at this link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=7c9e3c71-759d-e911-80f8-005056b64545&fromRfxSummary=True&rfxId=ee9697e3-7da4-e911-80f8-005056b64545
Additional Text: Request to participate and procurement documents are available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=7c9e3c71-759d-e911-80f8-005056b64545&fromRfxSummary=True&rfxId=ee9697e3-7da4-e911-80f8-005056b64545 The ITT is to be completed and submitted on the ProContract system.

Title: Change and Integration Partner
Description: North East Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) and the North East Lincolnshire Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG), require a Consultant who will work with them to develop and embed skills and capabilities for change, enabling the Authority and the CCG to become a single organisation (the Union). The Consultant must develop the corporate core of the Union to become an efficient shared function with the capability to respond to and deliver change, enabling the Union to shape North East Lincolnshire as a place and support the health and wellbeing of the people who live in the borough. Title: Digital Outcomes Solutions Framework
Description:
A digital outcomes partner with an expert in designing services for the digital age to:

i)	deliver significant efficiency savings
ii)	redesign services to be customer centric/relevant to the districts changing needs
iii)	redesign services to be digitally enabled/improve customer satisfaction, and
iv)	assist in developing an internal culture and skill set. 

The Council needs to make savings, increase efficiency and also meet the expectations of the districts citizens in delivering services which are centered around their needs. It wishes to take an agile service design approach to transformation in order to make significant and accelerated progress to meet these key aims. this work will directly contribute to the outcomes defined in the Councils Plan and assist in delivering the £30.7m savings by 2020.
